results.title: Lost in translation [DVD]
results.creator_credit: American Zoetrope, Elemental Films, Ross Katz and Sofia Coppola
results.brief_description: Two kindred spirits, both hitched but essentially partnerless, seek solace and distraction in this updated take on “Brief encounter”. Bill Murray simply excels as Bob - a jaded film star whose career and marriage are sagging whilst he vaguely goes through the motions, resigned to the humiliations and compromises of middle age. Charlotte by contrast, still struggles with disappointment, set in early, of her marriage and the irony of her loneliness. The visual overload of a vibrant, tasteless, seedy, bustling, 24/7 Tokyo provides the backdrop to the pair’s melancholia and united quietude. Sophia Coppola was nominated for Best director, winning an Academy Award for her wonderfully droll and witty screenplay. Also stars Giovanni Ribisi. Also available on VHS [318955].

results.title: Lost in the bush
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry, Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre and Peter Dodds
results.brief_description: A film based on an actual incident. In 1864 three young children belonging to a small squatting family wandered far from home and found themselves lost in the Australian outback. The film concentrates on the children’s struggle to survive in the bush and on the search mounted by their family to find them. Based on the account of the search written by Les Blake in the 1860’s. Cast includes Gabrielle Bulle, Colin Freckleton, Richard McClelland.

results.title: Lost in space
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Mark W Koch, Stephen Hopkins, Akiva Goldsman and Carla Fay
results.brief_description: In the not too distant future, earth is on the verge of total collapse and survival lies on colonising outer space. All hope rests on the Robinson family, whose mission is to establish life on Alpha Prime, the only other habitable planet in the galaxy. However when their spacecraft is sabotaged by a traitor, they find themselves lost in space and flying headlong into some out of this world dangers. Cast includes William Hurt, Gary Oldman, Matt LeBlanc, Mimi Rogers, Heather Graham and Lacey Chabert.

results.title: Lost in a crowd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Forty Minutes”.
In this essay on loneliness, five characters in search of someone are sitting on a train. The film shows how each has unsuccessfully tried to remedy their situation. All five share a common problem yet as the train goes down the line not a word is spoken.

results.title: Lost highways: the roadside photography of Richard Szymczuk
results.brief_description: A fascinating look into the world of Australian photographer Richard Szymczuk and his passion for the urban/industrial landscape of Geelong and its surrounding environs. Since 1987 Richard has been on a mission photographing old rundown servos, milkbars, general stores, billboards, factories, recording history before it literally disappears or is replaced. His photographs have become an art form of social expression and reflect today’s society of economic rationalism. In the film Richard talks about his background, his work and his philosophy on life reflecting on the ever-changing landscape as evidenced by the many examples of his photographic works and his revisits to some of the original locales that feature throughout the documentary. Photographed by Simon Anderson with Simon Kirby and music by Steven Baker.

results.title: Lost book found
results.brief_description: The result of over five years of Super 8 and 16mm filming on New York City streets, ‘Lost Book Found’ melds documentary and narrative approaches into a complex meditation on city life. The piece revolves around a mysterious notebook filled with obsessive listings of places, objects, and incidents which serve as the key to a hidden city. It is a city on unconsidered geographies and layered artefacts - the relics of low-level capitalism and the debris of countless forgotten narratives. The project stems from the filmmaker’s first job in New York - working as a pushcart vendor on Canal Street. As usual, Cohen shot in hundreds of locations using unobtrusive equipment and generally without any crew. Influenced by the work of Walter Benjamin, Cohen created ‘an archive of undirected shots and sounds, then set out to explore the boundary’ between genres. During the process Cohen said, ‘I found connections between the street vendor, Benjamin’s ‘flaneur’ and my own work as an observer and collector of ephemeral street life’.

results.title: Lost 4 H-bombs!
results.brief_description: On the 17th January, 1966, a plane of the United States Air Force lost four hydrogen bombs near the fishing village of Palomares, in southern Spain. Tells of the subsequent search of the bombs, their recovery, and the impact of this nuclear accident on the people involved: the villagers, a general of the Spanish Air Ministry, the Duchess of Medina Sidonia and American personnel.

results.title: Lost
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A girl finds herself entrapped in a bizarre fantasy land when she goes to a park and is invited to play by a group of ghostly figures…is it real, or just part of a dream?
